work_experience.title: MASTER THESIS
work_experience.description: The thesis is on the topic: "Differentiable Monte-Carlo simulator for scanning electron microscope images". The thesis aims to adopt a segmented or divided approach for inverse rendering, employing a partitioned forward and backward call to get the baseline topology/geometry of the substrate.

education.institution: K.J Somaiya of Institute of Engineering and Information Technology

projects.name: Reinforcement learning for a simple jump and run game
projects.description: This project is developed using Unity Framework implementing the Reinforcement Learning algorithm PPO to train the ML-Agent to Jump and run and earn Reward points by jumping over obstacles and collecting coins. Each level has increasing difficulties and important choices for the Agent to make.

projects.name: Human Activity Recognition (HAR) using Deep Learning
projects.description: The aim of the project is to classify Human Activity during a basketball using accelerometer sensor data with the help of Deep Neural Networks. The Task included analysis of the data using Power BI and identifying potential imbalances in the dataset followed by finding solutions to increase accuracy based on these pitfalls found. Three Models, Single LSTM, double stacked LSTM, and Transfer learning using ResNet were implemented. Different approaches such as K-Fold and LOSO were also experimented on. Our implementation has outperformed the benchmark algorithm. For example, For the drill: the expected results (F1 Score) for some labels were just 5-15% whereas our model gave 21% and above.

projects.name: Image Classification Challenge
description: The aim of the project was to work on a dataset from Kaggle and to classify the corresponding images accurately.
The classification challenge was a part of the Deep Learning competition held at my university. Various Neural networks such as Resnet, Alexnet, and Imagenet were compared for Image classification.
The project was completed with 95% accuracy and secured 2nd Position in the challenge. The entire project was coded in PyTorch.

projects.name: Handling Ambiguous Data in Object Detection
projects.description: The Project proposes a way to handle ambiguous data in the MOT dataset and presents a possible solution for reducing false positives in the output by IoU weighting.

projects.name: Robotics Project
description: I have actively participated in a range of robotics undertakings, encompassing the development of a step-climbing robot, a quadrupedal robot, and several other pioneering projects.
I also was part of a team participating in ABU Robocon and ranked 3rd in India in the year 2018.

projects.name: Bachelor Thesis
projects.title: Voiceless Speech recognition
projects.description: The system aims to allow the users to converse silently with a computing device. It thus enables the user to communicate with devices and AI assistants in a voiceless and discrete manner. The user's intention to speak and internal speech is characterized by neuromuscular signals by the speech articulating muscles captured by this system to reconstruct this speech.
